<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ARM math functions are statically linked on Android from libgcc.a, but not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// available at runtime for dynamic linking. On Linux these are usually placed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// in libgcc&#95;s.so so can be found by normal dynamic lookup.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#if defined(&#95;&#95;BIONIC&#95;&#95;) &amp;&amp; defined(&#95;&#95;arm&#95;&#95;)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// List of functions which are statically linked on Android and can be generated</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// by LLVM. This is done as a nested macro which is used once to declare the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// imported functions with ARM&#95;MATH&#95;DECL and once to compare them to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// user-requested symbol in getSymbolAddress with ARM&#95;MATH&#95;CHECK. The test</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// assumes that all functions start with &#95;&#95;aeabi&#95; and getSymbolAddress must be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// modified if that changes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#define ARM&#95;MATH&#95;IMPORTS(PP) \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">  PP(&#95;&#95;aeabi&#95;d2f) \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">  PP(&#95;&#95;aeabi&#95;d2iz) \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">  PP(&#95;&#95;aeabi&#95;d2lz) \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">  PP(&#95;&#95;aeabi&#95;d2uiz) \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">  PP(&#95;&#95;aeabi&#95;d2ulz) \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">  PP(&#95;&#95;aeabi&#95;dadd) \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">  PP(&#95;&#95;aeabi&#95;dcmpeq) \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">  PP(&#95;&#95;aeabi&#95;dcmpge) \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">  PP(&#95;&#95;aeabi&#95;dcmpgt) \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">  PP(&#95;&#95;aeabi&#95;dcmple) \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">  PP(&#95;&#95;aeabi&#95;dcmplt) \\</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">  PP(&#95;&#95;aeabi&#95;uldivmod)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Declare statically linked math functions on ARM. The function declarations</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// here do not have the correct prototypes for each function in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ARM&#95;MATH&#95;IMPORTS, but it doesn&#39;t matter because only the symbol addresses are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// needed. In particular the &#95;&#95;aeabi&#95;&#42;divmod functions do not have calling</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// conventions which match any C prototype.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#define ARM&#95;MATH&#95;DECL(name) extern &quot;C&quot; void name();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><span class="doxyHighlight">ARM&#95;MATH&#95;IMPORTS(ARM&#95;MATH&#95;DECL)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#undef ARM&#95;MATH&#95;DECL</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#if defined(&#95;&#95;linux&#95;&#95;) &amp;&amp; defined(&#95;&#95;GLIBC&#95;&#95;) &amp;&amp; \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">      (defined(&#95;&#95;i386&#95;&#95;) || defined(&#95;&#95;x86&#95;64&#95;&#95;))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">extern</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;C&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/compiler-h/#aa874be876d9bf6f48931e94c251734ce">LLVM&#95;ATTRIBUTE&#95;WEAK</a> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#95;&#95;morestack();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlight">uint64&#95;t</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/rtdyldmemorymanager/#a5fee247bdc0c5af393b66bfd73a0a347"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/rtdyldmemorymanager/#a5fee247bdc0c5af393b66bfd73a0a347">RTDyldMemoryManager::getSymbolAddressInProcess</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> std::string &amp;Name) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This implementation assumes that the host program is the target.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Clients generating code for a remote target should implement their own</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// memory manager.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#if defined(&#95;&#95;linux&#95;&#95;) &amp;&amp; defined(&#95;&#95;GLIBC&#95;&#95;)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===--------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Function stubs that are invoked instead of certain library calls</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Force the following functions to be linked in to anything that uses the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// JIT. This is a hack designed to work around the all-too-clever Glibc</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// strategy of making these functions work differently when inlined vs. when</span></CodeLine>
